results.content: Good course, though  some of advanced concepts (chapter 6 and 7) could be explained in more detailed way, but overall I've got a lot of useful information.
results.content_html: Good course, though some of advanced concepts (chapter 6 and 7) could be explained in more detailed way, but overall I've got a lot of useful information.

results.content: Sound quality was poor and affected audibility negatively. The font-size used in the various editors was awful, causing me eyestrain. Most of the early demos illustrated code error conditions instead of just illustrating code that works (Analogous to a driving instructor teaching you how to drive by demonstrating things that cause accidents). The lectures were not linked together by a common project, so from one lecture to the next, the demos appeared disjointed. There was no real explanation of WebAssembly concepts or how WebAssembly components relate to each other.
results.content_html: Sound quality was poor and affected audibility negatively. The font-size used in the various editors was awful, causing me eyestrain. Most of the early demos illustrated code error conditions instead of just illustrating code that works (Analogous to a driving instructor teaching you how to drive by demonstrating things that cause accidents). The lectures were not linked together by a common project, so from one lecture to the next, the demos appeared disjointed. There was no real explanation of WebAssembly concepts or how WebAssembly components relate to each other.

results.content: This course is very useful for me, to understand WebAssembly's basic concepts and so on. It was great for me I could see the sample project using QT.
results.content_html: This course is very useful for me, to understand WebAssembly's basic concepts and so on. It was great for me I could see the sample project using QT.

results.content: Code examples I have seen thus far had a much too small font size to be readable.  I suggest to explode the code snippets to fill the available screen space to make it more readable. Uses drawl green and purple with a black background and a small font size. I had a lot of difficulty reading this. When it comes to content, why mention Tables if we are not supposed to read or write the values?

response.content:
Hi Edward,
 I'm so sorry that you had these problems. I will increase the font size in the future for other courses, didn't notice that it might be a problem. As I can see, Udemy compressed these videos a lot, because the original footage is much more clearer and easier to read. That is why I talked with the support and made sure that in a few days from now, every video will be available in 1080p resolution. That should help a lot with reading the text.
 As for the tables, I explained them in more detail in a later part of the course, don't know if you reached that yet. Anyways, thanks for the review and I will try to improve the quality in the future. For any more questions, write me a message and I will help to make everything clear.
Krisztián Sala

results.content: I have hard time understanding. I feel the teacher goes really fast.

response.content:
Hi, Brian, thanks for the review. I plan on adding practice activities soon, so you will have more material to practice. And you may feel that the information may be overwhelming at first, since everything is new, but if you continue watching and start coding along with the course, everything will be much clearer. Could you please elaborate what is wrong with the course description, so that I can correct it?
Thanks again,
Krisztián Sala
